author: sina.com.cn
title: 中国羽毛球队一队晋江集结|中国羽毛球队_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
本报讯 （记者 肖榕） 日前，中国羽毛球队一队首批队员抵达晋江，他们将在晋江市少体校展开为期两个月的封闭式集训，备战今年的国际赛事和2028年洛杉矶奥运会。
据悉，此次国羽一队来晋江封闭式集训一行共79人，集训时间从3月16日起至5月11日结束，首批抵达晋江的集训人员包括巴黎奥运会女双冠军得主陈清晨。而石宇奇、陈雨菲、黄东萍、王昶、梁伟铿等众多国羽一队主力队员刚刚结束全英公开赛的角逐，也将陆续抵达晋江，与大部队会合。
日前在伯明翰结束的全英羽毛球公开赛上，中国羽毛球队闯入男单、女单和混双三项决赛，最终斩获两金两银。其中，国羽混双时隔22年再度包揽全英公开赛冠亚军。在决赛中，7号种子郭新娃/陈芳卉战胜5号种子冯彦哲/魏雅欣，收获第一个世界羽联巡回赛超级1000赛冠军。在男单决赛中，石宇奇击败本届全英赛的“黑马”、中国台北选手李佳豪，时隔7年再度捧杯。此外，黄东萍、韩悦、何济霆、谭宁等4名福建选手也有上佳表现，均闯入半决赛。
记者了解到，为保障国家羽毛球一队集训顺利进行，晋江市少体校对训练及食宿保障等各项工作均已准备妥当，将一如既往地为国家队提供全方位、高品质的后勤保障。

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Bird infected with H5N1 found in Ogle County
text:
By John Clark ,
2 hours ago
OGLE COUNTY, Ill. (WTVO) — The Ogle County Health Department has confirmed a bird found in Rochelle has tested positive for H5N1 or bird flu.
Bird flu can infect poultry and other domestic animals, but does not normally infect humans.
The virus was first detected in U.S. dairy cattle in March. Since then, bird flu has been confirmed in at least 866 herds in 16 states.
More than 60 people in eight states have been infected, with mostly mild illnesses, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The Louisiana Department of Health said a resident from the southwestern portion of the state had been hospitalized after exposure to sick and dead birds suspected of having the virus.
H5N1 is a virus that causes respiratory illness in birds.
The outbreak has resulted in 60 cases of the flu in humans. 37 of those cases were transmitted from infected cattle.
University of Illinois Professor of Animal Sciences Dr. Jim Drackley said those infections are primarily from raw milk consumption.
“I would say the risk to humans is incredibly small, at this time, from the dairy products that we’ve consumed from stores,” Drackley said. “I would always recommend that people don’t consume raw milk, in which case the virus could still be there.”
This week, the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) began mandatory testing of the nation’s milk supply for traces of H5N1, after bird flu was first detected in U.S. dairy cows in March.
Since then, it has been found in 832 dairy herds across 16 states, including Iowa, Minnesota, and Michigan.
No human-to-human transmission has occurred in the U.S.
Officials with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention stressed that the virus poses low risk to the general public.
The Ogle County Health Department reminds the public not to handle wild birds that are sick or found dead, and say the public should call 815-562-6976 if a dead bird is found on their property.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist [Mary Walrath-Holdridge](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/12093029002/mary-walrathholdridge/) A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and [Molldrem Family Dentistry](https://molldremdentistry.com/) caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. Treatment called 'inconceivable' “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote [Dr. Avrum Goldstein,](https://www.seakexperts.com/members/4827-avrum-r-goldstein) a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at [NOVA Southeastern University](https://dental.nova.edu/aboutus/faculty/goldstein-avrum%20.html?_gl=1*1kqtqxq*_gcl_au*ODA4NzUxNTA1LjE3MDM3OTc5MjI.), also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: [They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.](/story/news/health/2023/11/07/doctors-accidentally-remove-wrong-organ-surgery/71487292007/) The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: ETMarkets.com
title: Nifty today: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session - The Economic Times
text: Equity markets scaled fresh highs on Thursday, boosted by lower crude prices in international markets and fresh foreign fund inflows amid largely positive global cues. Overall we expect positive momentum to continue and markets to end the year on a buoyant note, said Siddhartha Khemka, Head - Retail Research, Motilal Oswal.Here's breaking down the pre-market actions:STATE OF THE MARKETSTech View: Having moved above the initial hurdle of 21650 levels, the Nifty is expected to advance towards the next overhead resistance of 22,200 levels in the near term, which is near the 100% Fibonacci extension of major bottom-top-bottoms. Immediate support is at 21550 levels, Nagaraj Shetti of HDFC Securities said.India VIX: India VIX, which is a measure of the fear in the markets, fell 2.68% to settle at 15.14 levels.US stocks end flatThe S&P 500 closed nominally higher on Thursday, retracing early gains just before the closing bell on the penultimate trading day of 2023.Dow up 0.14%, S&P gains 0.04%, Nasdaq off 0.03%Asian shares mixedAsian stocks traded mixed in the last session of the year after US stocks eked out a gain and as investors bargain-hunt in China. S&P 500 futures were little changed as of 9:09 a.m. Tokyo timeJapan’s Topix rose 0.4%Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 fell 0.3%Hang Seng futures fell 0.4%Stocks in F&O ban today1) Hindustan CopperSecurities in the ban period under the F&O segment include companies in which the security has crossed 95% of the market-wide position limit.FII/DII actionForeign portfolio investors were net buyers at Rs 4,358 crore on Wednesday. DIIs sold shares worth Rs 136 crore.RupeeThe rupee rebounded after two straight days of fall to settle 14 paise higher at 83.20 against the US dollar on Thursday, amid a weak American currency overseas and a rally in domestic equity markets.FII dataThe net long of FIIs increased from Rs 74,252 crore on Wednesday to Rs 81,638 crore on Thursday.

author: CMS Medios
title: Pugnarán por proteger a los huérfanos del feminicidio en BC | Noticias de Tijuana | EL IMPARCIAL
text: Pugnarán por proteger a los huérfanos del feminicidio en BC En los casos en los que las víctimas de feminicidio tuvieron hijos debió aplicarse un protocolo de orfandad donde tenía que haber intervenido la Procuraduría de la Defensa del Menor en el Estado. Ensenada, BC.- El problema de los feminicidios en el Estado ha dejado a una gran cantidad de menores desprotegidos que actualmente no reciben ningún apoyo, denunció Miriam Ayón Castro, integrante de la [Red de Mujeres Unidas por Baja California.](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/tijuana/Ocupa-Baja-California-tercer-lugar-en-muertes-violentas-y-numero-13-en-feminicidios-20230918-0027.html) Recordó que en agosto de este año la red en conjunto con la Comisión Estatal de Derechos Humanos publicó un estudio sobre feminicidios, que arrojó que en el estado hay 51 sentencias de feminicidio que están catalogadas por el poder Judicial como sentencias con perspectiva de género. Te puede interesar: [Apoyan a mujeres víctimas de violencia vicaria](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/tijuana/Atiende-Colectivo-Cesodi-50-casos-de-mujeres-victimas-de-violencia-vicaria-20231115-0033.html) “Aplicando un mecanismo y un protocolo ya establecido por la Suprema Corte de Justicia nos encontramos con que el gran porcentaje de esas sentencias no cumplen con la perspectiva de género y justamente uno de los indicadores que evaluamos fue la atención a las víctimas y a los huérfanos del feminicidio”, expuso. Protocolo de orfandad Puntualizó que en los casos en los que las víctimas de feminicidio tuvieron hijos debió aplicarse un protocolo de orfandad donde tenía que haber intervenido la Procuraduría de la Defensa del Menor en el Estado. Hoy en día no hay una autoridad que nos pueda indicar qué ha pasado con los huérfanos del feminicidio, nos percatarnos que no había una reparación integral del daño, la ley establece cuáles son los elementos que se tienen que considerar para determinar la reparación del daño y la cuantía en cuanto al monto que el agresor tendrá que pagar como una indemnización a las víctimas y encontramos que se hizo todo de machote y solo se le puso el precio a la víctima sin considerarse las condiciones”, señaló. La activista dijo que se debe de considerar si el menor estaba en cierto nivel educativo y tenía ciertas necesidades, si el menor tenía alguna discapacidad o enfermedad que requiriera atención especial, las condiciones económicas de la familia que se hizo cargo del menor, entre otros elementos que se deben contemplar para que el menor tenga una vida digna. Te puede interesar: [Red de mujeres de BC invitan a usar ''lentes violeta'' para equidad y justicia](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/tijuana/Red-de-mujeres-de-BC-invitan-a-usar-lentes-violeta-para-equidad-y-justicia-20231110-0039.html) “Si esa madre era el sustento o la jefa de familia de ese menor y no el padre como hay muchos casos en Baja California, eso también tiene que ser determinado al momento de determinar la cuantía de la reparación del daño, todos estos elementos no se tomaron en cuenta”, lamentó. Sentencias Refirió que en gran parte de los casos el agresor habría reconocido ser pareja de la víctima y por lo tanto con base en eso fue catalogado como un feminicidio y por consiguiente fue determinada una sentencia a través de un procedimiento abreviado. “No se profundizó y no se llevó un proceso legal ordinario como debió haber sido, hablando de un delito tan grave y más donde hay menores involucrados, fueron definidos por un procedimiento abreviado donde el reconocimiento del agresor donde asumía la culpa fue el elemento que fue considerado para tener una sentencia condenatoria, sin embargo, no se repara el daño ni representa una reparación integral”, enfatizó. Protección a menores Puntualizó que el próximo año la [Red de Mujeres Unidas por BC ](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/ensenada/Red-de-Mujeres-Unidas-por-Baja-California-exige-igualdad-en-la-justicia-20230917-0023.html)pugnará para que se proteja a los menores en esta situación y se aplique el protocolo de orfandad. Te puede interesar: [Exigen informe sobre los recursos destinados a la violencia de género](https://www.elimparcial.com/tijuana/ensenada/Exigen-informe-sobre-los-recursos-destinados-a-la-violencia-de-genero-20231105-0019.html) “Vamos a seguir impulsando para que todos estos elementos que encontramos en estos instrumentos de análisis que llevamos a cabo durante 2023 sigan siendo atendidos”, afirmó.
